ojc.bain.misc

Class SynapseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.bain.misc.SynapseTest

  • public class SynapseTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to test the behaviour of synapse models on given spiking protocols.
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • singleTest

        public static TestResults singleTest(NeuralNetwork network,
                     long simSteps,
                     boolean logSpikesAndStateVariables,
                     long simStepsNoSpikes)
        Test the behaviour of a synapse model.
        Parameters:
        network - A neural network containing two neurons and a single synapse to be tested. The neurons at index 0 and 1 should be the pre- and post-synaptic neurons respectively, and are typically configured to produce a fixed firing pattern (though any neuron type and firing pattern are permitted).
        simSteps - The number of steps to run the simulation for.
        logSpikesAndStateVariables - Whether to record pre- and post-synaptic spikes and any state variables exposed by the synapse model in the test results.
        simStepsNoSpikes - The number of steps to run the simulation for with no spiking after the normal spike test. This is useful for testing models which change the efficacy in the absence of spikes.
        Returns:
        For a single spike protocol, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP consisting of series labelled "Time" and "Efficacy" and if logSpikesAndStateVariables == true then also "Pre-synaptic spikes", "Post-synaptic spikes" and any state variables exposed by the synapse model.

      • testPattern

        public static TestResults testPattern(SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapse,
                      int timeResolution,
                      double period,
                      int repetitions,
                      double[][][] patterns,
                      int[][] refSpikeIndexes,
                      int[][] refSpikePreOrPost,
                      boolean logSpikesAndStateVariables,
                      javax.swing.ProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Test a synapse on the specified spiking protocol or a series of spiking protocols derived from initial and final protocols by interpolation over one or two dimensions.
        Parameters:
        synapse - The SynapseCollection containing the synapse to test (the first synapse is used).
        timeResolution - The time resolution to use in the simulation, see NeuralNetwork
        period - The period of the spike pattern in seconds.
        repetitions - The number of times to apply the spike pattern.
        patterns - Array containing spike patterns, in the form [initial, dim 1, dim 2][pre, post][spike number] = spike time. The [spike number] array contains the times (s) of each spike, relative to the beginning of the pattern. See FixedProtocolNeuronCollection.
        refSpikeIndexes - Array specifying indexes of the two spikes to use as timing variation references for each variation dimension, in the form [dim 1, dim 2][reference spike, relative spike] = spike index.
        refSpikePreOrPost - Array specifying whether the timing variation reference spikes specified by refSpikeIndexes belong to the pre- or post-synaptic neurons, in the form [dim 1, dim 2][base spike, relative spike] = Constants.PRE or Constants.POST.
        logSpikesAndStateVariables - Whether to record pre- and post-synaptic spikes and any state variables exposed by the synapse model in the test results.
        progressMonitor - If not null, this will be updated with the current progress.
        Returns:
        For a single spike protocol, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP consisting of series labelled "Time" and "Efficacy" and if logSpikesAndStateVariables == true then also "Pre-synaptic spikes", "Post-synaptic spikes" and any state variables exposed by the synapse model. For a protocol varied over one dimension, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP_1D consisting of series labelled "Time delta" and "Efficacy". For a protocol varied over two dimensions, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP_2D consisting of series labelled "Time delta 1", "Time delta 2" and "Efficacy".
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • testPattern

        public static TestResults[] testPattern(SynapseCollection<? extends ComponentConfiguration> synapse,
                        java.lang.String[] configurationLabels,
                        ComponentConfiguration[] configurations,
                        int timeResolution,
                        double period,
                        int repetitions,
                        double[][][] patterns,
                        int[][] refSpikeIndexes,
                        int[][] refSpikePreOrPost,
                        boolean logSpikesAndStateVariables,
                        javax.swing.ProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Test a synapse on the specified spiking protocol or a series of spiking protocols derived from initial and final protocols by interpolation over one or two dimensions. The synapse is tested over all specified parameter configurations.
        Parameters:
        synapse - The SynapseCollection containing the synapse to test (the first synapse is used). The first configuration (at index 0) in the collection will be replaced with each configuration specified by the configurations argument.
        configurationLabels - An array containing the labels for each parameter configuration to test on. These are used to label the data sets in the returned TestResults.
        configurations - An array containing the parameter configurations to test on.
        timeResolution - The time resolution to use in the simulation, see NeuralNetwork
        period - The period of the spike pattern in seconds.
        repetitions - The number of times to apply the spike pattern.
        patterns - Array containing spike patterns, in the form [initial, dim 1, dim 2][pre, post][spike number] = spike time. The [spike number] array contains the times (s) of each spike, relative to the beginning of the pattern. See FixedProtocolNeuronCollection.
        refSpikeIndexes - Array specifying indexes of the two spikes to use as timing variation references for each variation dimension, in the form [dim 1, dim 2][reference spike, relative spike] = spike index.
        refSpikePreOrPost - Array specifying whether the timing variation reference spikes specified by refSpikeIndexes belong to the pre- or post-synaptic neurons, in the form [dim 1, dim 2][base spike, relative spike] = Constants.PRE or Constants.POST.
        logSpikesAndStateVariables - Whether to record pre- and post-synaptic spikes and any state variables exposed by the synapse model in the test results.
        progressMonitor - If not null, this will be updated to display the progress of the test.
        Returns:
        For a single spike protocol, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP consisting of series labelled "Time" and "Efficacy" and if logSpikesAndStateVariables == true then also "Pre-synaptic spikes", "Post-synaptic spikes" and any state variables exposed by the synapse model. For a protocol varied over one dimension, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP_1D consisting of series labelled "Time delta" and "Efficacy". For a protocol varied over two dimensions, a TestResults object with type SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP_2D consisting of series labelled "Time delta 1", "Time delta 2" and "Efficacy".
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • createChart

        public static org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart createChart(TestResults results,
                                     int timeResolution,
                                     boolean logSpikesAndStateVariables,
                                     boolean showInFrame,
                                     java.lang.String title)
        Plot the results produced by the testing methods in this class.
        Parameters:
        results - The results of the test.
        timeResolution - The time resolution which the simulation was run at.
        logSpikesAndStateVariables - Whether to include pre- and post-synaptic spikes and any state variables exposed by the synapse model in the plot.
        showInFrame - Whether to display the result in a frame.

      • createChart

        public static org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart createChart(TestResults[] results,
                                     boolean singlePlot,
                                     int timeResolution,
                                     boolean logSpikesAndStateVariables,
                                     boolean showInFrame,
                                     java.lang.String title)
        Plot the results produced by the testing methods in this class.
        Parameters:
        results - The results of one or more tests. They must all have the same type SynapseTest.TYPE. If more than one result is to be plotted then only SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP or SynapseTest.TYPE.STDP_1D are supported, and it is assumed that they all have the same pre- and post-synaptic spike patterns.
        singlePlot - If plotting more than one TestResult then whether to show the results on a single plot (true) or separate plots (false).
        timeResolution - The time resolution which the simulation was run at.
        logSpikesAndStateVariables - Whether to include pre- and post-synaptic spikes and any state variables exposed by the synapse model in the plot. This is ignored if more than one result is to be plotted.
        showInFrame - Whether to display the result in a frame.
